I've still got this in I200312162000, as well as a NPE in StyledText.getGC()
[line 3715].  Both seem to indicate the renderer is set to null, which seems to
mean that the styled text is still processing these methods after it has been
disposed.

The StyledText must be getting disposed at some point after the platform calls 
back to Display.windowProc with the Paint event, because once a widget is 
disposed it is removed from the widget table and therefore should not be able 
to receive any events.

A repeatable case would be very helpful to see what's happening here.  SN 
suggests that perhaps a filterEvent listener is disposing it, or another 
thread, or something is running the gtk event loop at a bad time.
*** Bug 49468 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***
*** Bug 49936 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

This was fixed last week, and apparently is behaving well in recent nightly 
builds.  Changing to FIXED.
